verses.name: Proverbs 9:1
verses.text: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:

verses.name: Proverbs 9:2
verses.text: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:3
verses.text: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,

verses.name: Proverbs 9:4
verses.text: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

verses.name: Proverbs 9:5
verses.text: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:6
verses.text: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:7
verses.text: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:8
verses.text: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:9
verses.text: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:10
verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:11
verses.text: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:12
verses.text: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:13
verses.text: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:14
verses.text: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

verses.name: Proverbs 9:15
verses.text: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

verses.name: Proverbs 9:16
verses.text: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

verses.name: Proverbs 9:17
verses.text: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

verses.name: Proverbs 9:18
verses.text: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
